Replica Rest APIÂ¶

Overview

Resource Operation Description
BadReplicasStates GET /replicas/bad/states List bad replicas.
  POST /replicas/bad Declare bad replicas.
BadReplicasSummary GET /replicas/bad/summary List bad replicas by incident.
DatasetReplicas GET /replicas/(scope)/(name)/datasets List dataset replicas.
ListReplicas POST /replicas/list List all replicas for did.
Replicas PUT /replicas/ update replicas state.
  POST /replicas/ create replicas at RSE
  DELETE /replicas/ Delete replica at RSE.
  GET /replicas/(scope)/(name) List all replicas for did
ReplicasDIDs POST /replicas/dids List DIDs for replicas.
ReplicasRSE GET /replicas/rse/(rse) List dataset replicas per RSE.
SuspiciousReplicas POST /replicas/suspicious Declare suspicious replicas.

Details

GET /replicas/bad/summaryÂ¶

Return a summary of the bad replicas by incident.

Query Parameters:
 
  • rse_expression â The RSE expression.
  • from_date â The start date.
  • to_date â The end date.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/x-json-stream
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid auth token.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

List of bad replicas by incident.
GET /replicas/bad/statesÂ¶

List the bad or suspicious replicas by states.

Query Parameters:
 
  • state â The state of the file (SUSPICIOUS or BAD).
  • rse â The RSE name.
  • younger_than â date in format â%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%fâ to select bad replicas younger than this date.
  • older_than â date in format â%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%fâ to select bad replicas older than this date.
  • limit â The maximum number of replicas returned.
  • list_pfns â Flag to include pfns.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/x-json-stream
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid auth token.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

List of dicts of bad file replicas.
POST /replicas/suspiciousÂ¶

Declare a list of suspicious replicas.

Request JSON Object:
 
  • pfns (string) â The list of PFNs.
  • reason (string) â The reason of the loss.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/x-json-string
Status Codes:
  • 201 Created â Created.
  • 400 Bad Request â Cannot decode json parameter list.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid auth token.
  • 404 Not Found â Replica not found.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

A list of not successfully declared files.
POST /replicas/listÂ¶

List all replicas for data identifiers.

Request Headers:
 
  • HTTP_ACCEPT â application/metalink4+xml
Query Parameters:
 
  • schemes â A list of schemes to filter the replicas.
  • sort â Requested sorting of the result, e.g., âgeoipâ, âclosenessâ, âdynamicâ, ârankingâ.
Request JSON Object:
 
  • dids (list) â list of DIDs.
  • schemes (list) â A list of schemes to filter the replicas.
  • unavailable (bool) â Also include unavailable replicas.
  • all_states (bool) â Return all replicas whatever state they are in. Adds an extra âstatesâ entry in the result dictionary.
  • rse_expression (string) â The RSE expression to restrict on a list of RSEs.
  • client_location (dict) â Client location dictionary for PFN modification {âipâ, âfqdnâ, âsiteâ}.
  • sort (bool) â Requested sorting of the result, e.g., âgeoipâ, âclosenessâ, âdynamicâ, ârankingâ.
  • domain (string) â The network domain for the call, either None, âwanâ or âlanâ. None is fallback to âwanâ, âallâ is both [âlanâ,âwanâ]
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/x-json-stream
  • Content-Type â application/metalink4+xml
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 400 Bad Request â Cannot decode json parameter list.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid auth token.
  • 404 Not Found â DID not found.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

A dictionary containing all replicas information.
Returns:

A metalink description of replicas if metalink(4)+xml is specified in Accept:
POST /replicas/didsÂ¶

List the DIDs associated to a list of replicas.

Request JSON Object:
 
  • pfns (string) â The list of PFNs.
  • rse (string) â The RSE name.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/x-json-string
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 400 Bad Request â Cannot decode json parameter list.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

A list of dictionaries containing the mapping PFNs to DIDs.
POST /replicas/badÂ¶

Declare a list of bad replicas.

Request JSON Object:
 
  • pfns (string) â The list of PFNs.
  • reason (string) â The reason of the loss.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/x-json-string
Status Codes:
  • 201 Created â Created.
  • 400 Bad Request â Cannot decode json parameter list.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid auth token.
  • 404 Not Found â Replica not found.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

A list of not successfully declared files.
PUT /replicas/Â¶

Update a file replicas state at a given RSE.

Request JSON Object:
 
  • rse (string) â The RSE name.
  • files (list) â list of dicts with âscopeâ, ânameâ and âstateâ.
Status Codes:
  • 201 Created â Replica successfully updated.
  • 400 Bad Request â Cannot decode json parameter list.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid auth token.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
POST /replicas/Â¶

Create file replicas at a given RSE.

Request JSON Object:
 
  • rse (string) â The RSE name.
  • files (list) â list of dicts with âscopeâ, ânameâ, âbytesâ, âmetaâ and âadler32â.
  • ignore_availability (bool) â Flag to ignore the RSE blacklisting.
Status Codes:
  • 201 Created â Replica Successfully created.
  • 400 Bad Request â Invalid Path.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid auth token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE not found.
  • 409 Conflict â Replica already exists.
  • 409 Conflict â DID already exists.
  • 503 Service Unavailable â Resource Temporary Unavailable.
DELETE /replicas/Â¶

Delete file replicas at a given RSE.

Request JSON Object:
 
  • rse (string) â The RSE name.
  • files (list) â list of dicts with âscopeâ, ânameâ.
  • ignore_availability (bool) â Flag to ignore the RSE blacklisting.
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â Replica successfully deleted.
  • 400 Bad Request â Cannot decode json parameter list.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid auth token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE not found.
  • 404 Not Found â Replica not found.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
GET /replicas/(scope)/(name)Â¶

List all replicas for data identifiers.

HTTP Success:
200 OK
HTTP Error:
401 Unauthorized 500 InternalError
Request Headers:
 
  • HTTP_ACCEPT â application/metalink4+xml
Parameters:
  • scope â data identifier scope.
  • name â data identifier name.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/x-json-stream
  • Content-Type â application/metalink4+xml
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid auth token.
  • 404 Not Found â DID not found.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

A dictionary containing all replicas information.
Returns:

A metalink description of replicas if metalink(4)+xml is specified in Accept:
GET /replicas/rse/(rse)Â¶

List dataset replicas per RSE.

Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/x-json-stream
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid auth token.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

A dictionary containing all replicas on the RSE.
GET /replicas/(scope)/(name)/datasetsÂ¶

List dataset replicas.

Query Parameters:
 
  • deep â Flag to ennable lookup at the file level.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/x-json-stream
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid auth token.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

A dictionary containing all replicas information.
